questions.question: What is the percentage of the earth's surface covered by water?
How does the brain communicate sensations, thoughts, and actions?
Did dinosaurs and humans coexist?
What is Darwin's theory of the origin of species?
Why does a year consist of 365 days and a day of 24 hours?
questions.correctAnswer: Due to Earth's orbit around the sun and its rotation

questions.question: Why is the sky blue?
questions.correctAnswer: Due to scattering of sunlight by the atmosphere

questions.question: What causes a rainbow to appear?
questions.correctAnswer: Refraction, reflection, and dispersion of light in water droplets

questions.question: What makes diseases caused by viruses and bacteria hard to treat?
questions.correctAnswer: Their ability to mutate and develop resistance

questions.question: How old are the oldest fossils on Earth?
Why do we put salt on sidewalks when it snows?
questions.correctAnswer: To melt the ice and lower its freezing point

questions.question: Can wind travel faster than the speed of sound?
Why do clouds move if they are made of water vapor?
questions.correctAnswer: Due to air currents and wind

questions.question: Do I weigh less on the equator than at the North Pole?
Does the back of a rainbow look the same as its front side?
questions.correctAnswer: No, the back is less vibrant

questions.question: Does wasting household water remove it from the water cycle?
How can there be clouds in winter when it is too cold for water to stay as vapor?
questions.correctAnswer: Water vapor can still condense and form clouds in colder temperatures

questions.question: How do geologists use carbon dating to find the age of rocks?
questions.correctAnswer: They use the decay of radioactive carbon isotopes to determine the age

questions.question: How do icebergs lose their salt?
questions.correctAnswer: Icebergs form from freshwater glaciers, not saltwater

questions.question: How do wells get their water from underground rivers?
questions.correctAnswer: Wells tap into underground aquifers, not necessarily rivers

questions.question: How does a cloud fill up with water?
questions.correctAnswer: Water vapor condenses onto microscopic particles to form cloud droplets

questions.question: Could electronic devices charge themselves without being plugged into an electricity source?
questions.correctAnswer: No, they require an external power source

questions.question: Does a source of electricity ever run out of electrons?
questions.correctAnswer: No, electrons are not consumed or depleted in the process

questions.question: Do blind people dream in visual images?
questions.correctAnswer: It depends on whether they were born blind or lost their vision

questions.question: What is the speed of electricity?
questions.correctAnswer: The speed of electricity is close to the speed of light

questions.question: Why can't lightning strike the same place twice?
questions.correctAnswer: Lightning can strike the same place multiple times

questions.question: Why do car tires protect you from lightning strikes?
questions.correctAnswer: Car tires provide insulation from the ground

questions.question: Why does lightning push electricity through air, but common batteries do not?
questions.correctAnswer: Lightning involves high voltages and currents, whereas batteries produce low currents

questions.question: Why is a 12-volt household battery harmless, but the shock from a 12-volt car battery will kill you?
questions.correctAnswer: It's the current (amperage) that determines the severity of the shock, not just voltage

questions.question: Why were electrons chosen to be negatively charged? Wouldn't it make more sense to call electrons positively charged because when they move they make electricity?
questions.correctAnswer: Electron charge was assigned based on historical conventions, not the direction of electron flow in electric circuits

questions.question: What does DNA stand for?
How many bones are in the human body?
The concept of gravity was discovered by which famous physicist?
What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
Which is the main gas that makes up the Earth's atmosphere?
Humans and chimpanzees share roughly how much DNA?
What is the most abundant gas in the Earth's atmosphere?
Roughly how long does it take for the sun's light to reach Earth - 8 minutes, 8 hours, or 8 days?
Which famous British physicist wrote A Brief History of Time?
At what temperature are Celsius and Fahrenheit equal?
What modern-day country was Marie Curie born in?
What is the biggest planet in our solar system?
What name is given for the number of protons found in the nucleus of an atom?
How many vertebrae does the average human possess?
What was the name of the first man-made satellite launched by the Soviet Union in 1957?
Which oath of ethics taken by doctors is named after an Ancient Greek physician?
What is a material that will not carry an electrical charge called?
Which Apollo moon mission was the first to carry a lunar rover?
How many teeth does an adult human have?
What is the study of mushrooms called?
How many brains and how many hearts does an octopus have?
